translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda Vinaya

source_sentence: 卷第十七
translation: Vol. 17

source_sentence: 大唐三藏義淨奉　制譯
translation: Translation of the Tripiṭaka of the Great Tang by Yijing Feng

source_sentence: 諸大弟子說業報緣
translation: the causes and conditions of karmic retribution as explained by the great disciples

source_sentence: 爾時諸大聲聞耆宿苾芻告具壽薄俱羅曰：「具壽財益已說本業，次至仁說本業因緣。」
translation: It was then that the śrāvakas and senior monks addressed Kauśāmbī Bhagrī, "Kauśāmbī has already explained his past actions, and next he'll explain the causes and conditions of his past actions."

source_sentence: 爾時薄俱羅苾芻以頌說曰：「昔於親惠城，　　而為賣藥人；　毘鉢尸住世，　　諸佛及僧伽。
translation: It was then that the Bhākrū temple recited this verse, saying, "In the past, I was a medicine seller in the city of Hōkai; Vipaśyin lived in the world, and the buddhas and saṃgha gave medicines to treat illnesses.

source_sentence: 施諸療病藥，　　來者求皆與；　根莖葉花藥，　　合以施眾僧。
translation: He gave medicines for healing illnesses to those who came seeking them, and he combined the roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and medicines to give to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 三月夏安居，　　隨食而供給；　於諸苾芻眾，　　人施一訶梨。
translation: During the three months of summer retreat, he offers food as he goes along, and each of the bhikṣus gives a single heli.

source_sentence: 九十一劫中，　　不墮三惡趣；　由其施藥報，　　獲斯殊大果。
translation: During 91 eons, he won't fall into the three bad destinies, and because of the rewards of his medicine giving, he attains this extraordinary fruit.

source_sentence: 雖施少分藥，　　受樂轉無窮；　施一訶梨勒，　　生天受天樂。
translation: Even though he gives a little medicine, his enjoyment will never end; after giving a single heli, he'll be born in heaven and experience heavenly bliss.

source_sentence: 有殘餘業報，　　復得生人中；　生在有學家，　　不受信心食。
translation: With the results of residual karma, he'll be reborn among men, and born among men of influence, he won't receive the food of faith.

source_sentence: 於三日夜中，　　解了三藏教；　服著垢弊衣，　　但唯求糞掃，　常樂居閑靜，　　不愛俗喧林。
translation: During three days and nights, he understands the teachings of the Tripiṭaka; he wears filthy robes and seeks only to clean up after himself; he always enjoys living in quietude and doesn't like the noisy worldly forest.

source_sentence: 我年百六十，　　不曾身有病，　我憶施少分，　　多受天人樂。
translation: I'm 160 years old, but I've never been physically ill, and I recall giving a small amount and receiving the pleasure of gods and humans.

source_sentence: 薄俱羅眾前，　　自說昔業報；　安坐蓮花內，　　無熱大池中。」
translation: Before the Bhagavān, I told myself the results of my past actions; I sat inside a lotus blossom in a large, unheated pond."

source_sentence: 爾時諸大聲聞耆宿苾芻告具壽尊者苾芻曰：「具壽薄俱羅已說昔業報，次至仁說。」
translation: It was then that the śrāvakas and senior monks addressed Venerable Gosshou Bhagavān, saying, "Gosshou Bhagavān has already explained the results of past actions, so next he'll explain them to Rin."

source_sentence: 爾時具壽尊者即以伽他而說頌曰：「昔作治皮人，　　憶念前生事；　當時逢儉歲，　　煮皮而用食，　以此為存命。
translation: At that point, Venerable Gosshou then spoke a verse through a gāthā, saying, "In the past, I was a skin tamer who remembered the trouble I'd caused in the past. It was a frugal year when I boiled skins and used them for food, so I could save my life.

source_sentence: 後有一沙門，　從遠來求食；　　我當發清信，　皮食施沙門。
translation: Then, there was an ascetic who came from far away seeking food; I will give food from the skins to that ascetic with pure faith.

source_sentence: 獨覺尊食已，　對面昇虛空：　　我發清淨心，　合掌申供敬。
translation: After the self-enlightened honored one ate, he rose into the sky facing me: I aroused a pure heart, put my palms together, and declared my respect.

source_sentence: 見斯神變已，　更起慇重心：　　『願我當生處，　常遇如是聖；　　所獲殊勝果，　一如今聖者。』
translation: After seeing this miraculous transformation, I further aroused my attention, 'May I be born in a place where I'll always meet such sages, and the excellent results I'll attain will be those of the sages of today.'

source_sentence: 所施體無色，　亦無香美味；　　見者心清淨，　當施如是食。
translation: The body of the offering is formless, and there's no fragrance or flavor; the mind of the person who sees it is purified, and he or she will give such food.

source_sentence: 因雖施少分，　獲果乃無量，　　多引生天樂，　復得勝人身。
translation: Although the cause is given in small measure, the result is immeasurable, often leading to birth in heavenly bliss and the attainment of a superior body.

source_sentence: 此是最後身，　得生於人趣，　　親侍大導師，　無上等正覺。
translation: In this final body, I'll be born in a human destiny, serve the great teacher, and become unsurpassed and perfectly enlightened.

source_sentence: 我先所發願，　願證無上果；　　已獲阿羅漢，　除熱得清涼。
translation: I vowed to realize the unsurpassed result, and having already attained arhatship, I'll remove my fever and attain coolness.

source_sentence: 我名大尊者，　今對斯聖眾，　　自說昔業報，　無熱大池中。」
translation: I'm called the Great Honored One, and now I've told this noble assembly the results of my past actions, which were never hot in a large lake."

source_sentence: 爾時諸大聲聞耆宿苾芻，告具壽優樓頻螺迦葉、那提迦葉、伽耶迦葉等作如是言：「具壽尊者，已說昔業報，次至仁等當說。」
translation: It was then that the great śrāvakas and senior monks addressed Kauśūla Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, Nadī-Kāśyapa, and Gayā-Kāśyapa, saying, "Venerable Kauśūla has already explained the results of past actions, and next he will explain them to you, sir."

source_sentence: 爾時三人共以伽他而說頌曰：「我等昔為三商主，　　與諸兄弟同遊戲；　遇見迦葉佛滅塔，　　破壞摧落無多在。
translation: The three of them then spoke a verse together as a group of gathas, saying, "In the past, we were three merchant masters who played with our brothers when we came upon the cessation of Kāśyapa's stūpa, which had been destroyed and left in ruins.

source_sentence: 我等共勸商人眾，　　營造此塔復令新；　三人於此佛塔上，　　各懸寶蓋同崇建。
translation: Together, we encouraged the merchants to build this stūpa and make it new again; each of us hung a jeweled lid on this stūpa and venerated it together.

source_sentence: 由斯殊勝善業故，　　得生天上受歡娛；　天上福盡生人趣，　　獲得富貴常安樂；　今逢世尊等正覺，　　於佛教中而出家。
translation: Because of this remarkable good action, they'll be born in the heavens and enjoy their happiness; they'll end their fortune in the heavens and go to their birthplace; they'll attain wealth and constant happiness; and now they'll meet the Bhagavān, the perfectly enlightened one, who left home among the Buddhists.

source_sentence: 世尊在彼尼連側，　　現大神變運神通；　我等皆蒙示正法，　　得入無上涅槃宮。
translation: The Bhagavān showed us great miraculous powers on the Nairañjāna side, showed us the right teaching, and we were all able to enter the palace of unsurpassed nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 斯由敬重大師教，　　又於佛塔懸妙傘；　由斯差別種善根，　　能除熱惱清涼樂。
translation: Because we respect the great teacher's teaching and hang a wonderful umbrella over the stūpa, we'll cultivate good roots that are distinct and capable of ridding ourselves of feverish anxiety and cool bliss.

source_sentence: 優樓頻螺迦葉等，　　於諸耆宿尊者前，　自說往昔業因緣，　　無熱池中處蓮坐。」
translation: Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa and the others, in front of the venerable elders, told themselves the causes and conditions of their past actions, and they sat on a lotus in a non-hot pond."

source_sentence: 爾時諸大聲聞耆宿苾芻，告具壽名稱，作如是言：「優樓頻螺迦葉、那提迦葉、伽耶迦葉等各說本業，次至仁說。」
translation: It was then that the śrāvakas and senior monks told Kauśāmbī that he was to name and say, "Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, Nadī-Kāśyapa, and Gayā-Kāśyapa each explained their past actions, and then they went on to explain them to Rinpoche."

source_sentence: 爾時具壽名稱即以伽他而說頌曰：「我昔曾作賣香人，　　於諸藥性善分別；　時有婦人將女來，　　買香及藥至我所。
translation: It was then that Kauśāmbī said this verse in gāthā, "I once worked as a perfume seller and was skilled in discerning the properties of medicines.

source_sentence: 彼之少女美顏容，　　見者皆令貪欲染；　我見是女容儀已，　　不覺起心生愛著。
translation: She had a beautiful face, and those who saw her were stained by desire. After I saw her features, I didn't feel a desire for her arise in my mind.

source_sentence: 即執女手同遊戲，　　由斯惡業生惡趣；　後得人身常手枯，　　經於五百生受苦。
translation: I then took her hand and played with her, and because of that bad action I was born in a bad destiny; later, when I became a human being, my hand always withered, and I spent 500 lifetimes suffering.

source_sentence: 我今親事佛世尊，　　隨佛出家而學道；　今已證獲阿羅漢，　　能除熱惱得清涼。
translation: Now, I've served the Bhagavān, left home with him, and trained on his path; now that I've realized arhatship, I'm able to remove my fever and attain coolness.

source_sentence: 大德我思先惡業，　　已經百劫業不亡。
translation: Great virtuous one, I consider that my prior bad actions were not extinguished after a hundred eons of activity.

source_sentence: 「今已得神通，　　由有餘殘報；　我之左臂手，　　不如右手臂。
translation: "Now that I've attained supernormal powers, because of the residual effects, my left arm and hand aren't as powerful as my right arm.

source_sentence: 若男若女人，　　侵妻及奪夫；　常墮地獄中，　　恒受斯劇苦。
translation: If a man or woman assaults his wife and robs him of his husband, he'll always fall into hell and experience this terrible pain.

source_sentence: 樂遠離他妻，　　猶如踊火炎；　猶斯諸智者，　　與自妻歡娛。
translation: He's like a man who's happy to avoid other wives, like a fire blazing, or a wise man who takes delight in his own wife.

source_sentence: 汝等當審觀，　　貪染他妻妾；　恒於地獄受，　　長夜無休息。
translation: You must examine this, for you've been defiled by desire for another wife and concubine; you'll always be subject to hell, and there'll be no rest for a long time.

source_sentence: 我由作是罪，　　隨所在生身；　已受如斯報，　　捺落迦中生。
translation: Because I did this sin, I was born in whatever body I was in, and having received this kind of retribution, I was born among the hells.

source_sentence: 今此最後身，　　得入無上位；　解脫一切苦，　　去熱得清涼。
translation: Now, in this final body, I'll be able to enter the peerless position, liberate myself from all suffering, and escape the heat to attain coolness.

source_sentence: 欲求安樂處，　　不得婬他婦；　解脫諸煩惱，　　受於妙喜樂。
translation: Desiring to seek a place of comfort, I mustn't prostitute another woman; freed from the afflictions, I'll experience wonderful joy and happiness.

source_sentence: 我名稱苾芻，　　今於尊宿前，　說自昔業報，　　無熱大池中。」
translation: I'm called a monk, and now I've spoken before the honored elder about the results of my past actions in the large, unheated lake."

source_sentence: 爾時諸大聲聞耆宿苾芻告具壽火生曰：「具壽名稱已說昔業，次至仁說。」
translation: It was then that the śrāvakas and senior monks addressed Kauśāmbī, "Kauśāmbī's name has already been explained in terms of past actions, and he will next explain it to you, sir."

source_sentence: 爾時具壽火生以頌答曰：「我昔曾於親惠城，　　有佛正覺號毘鉢；　我時名為無所著，　　於眾人中最尊貴。
translation: Gusou Fosheng then replied with a verse, "Once upon a time in the city of Shin-hui, there was a Buddha who was perfectly enlightened and named Vipa; at the time, I was called Nothing Attached, and I was the most honored among people.

source_sentence: 佛有六十二萬眾，　　聲聞弟子共圍繞；　我屈毘鉢尸世尊，　　并諸弟子三月請。
translation: The Buddha had a multitude of 620,000 people surrounded by disciples of the śrāvakas, and I bent over the Bhagavān Vipaśyin and invited his disciples to come in March.

source_sentence: 于時親惠城國王，　　亦請世尊并弟子；　是時我與彼城王，　　隔日設食呈微供。
translation: The king of the city of Hōkaku also invited the Bhagavān and his disciples, and we partnered with the king of that city to make modest offerings of food every other day.

source_sentence: 至時我倍加供養，　　佛及苾芻聲聞眾；　三月供養事已畢，　　我更共王同供養。
translation: I then doubled my offerings to the Buddha and the śrāvakas, and after the three-month offering was completed, I joined the king in making offerings to them.

source_sentence: 當時最後設會日，　　親惠城王宮自辦；　廣設百味妙飲食，　　衣服臥具及諸珍。
translation: On the last day of the festival, the King of Hwaijō himself hosted a palace that was filled with a hundred delicious foods, clothing, bedding, and other treasures.

source_sentence: 既辦如斯上妙物，　　復於王苑敷高座；　其座價直百千金，　　飲食衣服同斯量。
translation: Having prepared such marvelous things, he then spread out a high seat in the king's court, which cost a hundred thousand pieces of gold, and his food and clothing were of the same amount.

source_sentence: 一一苾芻所施物，　　算數計分不能知；　所有象馬皆嚴飾，　　縷金線網莊嚴身。
translation: Each monk gives something that can't be calculated or counted, and all the elephants and horses are adorned, their bodies adorned with threads of gold.

source_sentence: 各各僧前持傘蓋，　　依座次第布周圓；　宮內婇女莊嚴身，　　以次旃檀塗瑩體。
translation: Each one carries an umbrella in front of the saṃgha and spreads it around in order from seat to seat, while the women in the palace adorn their bodies and coat their bodies with whitewash.

source_sentence: 各執金瓶盛德水，　　苾芻僧處遣祇承；　於是最後興斯供，　　王自供養佛僧伽。
translation: Each carries a golden vial full of merit and water, and the monks and saṃgha of the bhikṣu send their support; thus, the king makes this final offering to the Buddha, Saṃgha, and Saṃgha.

source_sentence: 我當見是王供養，　　一心正念作思惟：『上妙飲食皆能辦，　　寶座嚴飾實難為；　乍可辦餘上妙具，　　如王象馬無由得。』
translation: When I see this offering from the king, I focus my mind on right thought and contemplate, 'A wonderful meal is possible, and the ornamentation of a jeweled throne is really difficult to achieve; at first, I might be able to achieve other wonderful things, like the king's elephant and horse, which have no way of being obtained.'

source_sentence: 既作如斯言念已，　　帝釋天主應時來；　于時天帝報我言：　　『善哉助汝興供養。』
translation: After he had spoken and thought thus, the god Indra came in response, and then Indra answered me, 'Good, I'll help you make offerings.'

source_sentence: 天帝既述斯言已，　　便化最勝大園林；　其園芳麗甚超絕，　　諸天妙座遍莊嚴；　并持上妙天衣服，　　奉施佛及苾芻僧，　先請毘鉢尸世尊，　　并諸弟子聲聞眾。
translation: After he said those words, Indra transformed the most excellent large garden, whose beauty was extraordinary and whose marvelous seats were adorned by gods, and carried the finest celestial garments, presented them to the Buddha and the monks, invited Bhagavān Vipaśyin and his disciples, the śrāvakas, and gave them alms.

source_sentence: 于時天帝及諸天，　　第一寶象而來應；　各各執持天寶蓋，　　於僧頂上在空中。
translation: At the time, Indra and the gods responded with the first jeweled elephant, each carrying a jeweled canopy of heavenly treasures, which they placed in the air atop the saṃgha's head.

source_sentence: 「齎持天飲食，　　供養真聖眾；　復以天衣覆，　　得受人天樂。
translation: "They carried celestial food and drink to offer to the truly noble people, and they covered them with celestial robes so that they could enjoy the pleasures of humans and gods.

source_sentence: 九十一劫中，　　不墮三惡趣；　由斯先世善，　　感得柔軟身。
translation: During 91 eons, they won't fall into the three bad destinies; because of this prior goodness, they'll attain a flexible body.

source_sentence: 為大仙興供，　　大德毘鉢尸；　今此最後身，　　生於王舍城。
translation: Making offerings to the great sage, the great virtuous Vipaśyin, his final body was born in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 影勝王宮內，　　最尊豪族家，　王及大夫人，　　敬戀恩養育，　諸臣咸愛我，　　及所有國人。
translation: He was born in the palace of a great king, in the home of the most distinguished and powerful family, to a king and his great wife, who were fond of nurturing kindnesses, ministers who loved me, and all the people of his kingdom.

source_sentence: 常受於天上，　　諸天五欲樂，　既得是人身，　　反受諸天樂。
translation: They're always subject to the five heavenly pleasures, but since they've attained this body, they've instead experienced the pleasures of the gods.

source_sentence: 無上大導師，　　正覺牟尼主，　調伏人天故，　　而來王舍城。
translation: The unsurpassed great teacher, the perfectly enlightened Muni, came to Rājagṛha because he disciplines humans and gods.

source_sentence: 我當聞佛來，　　大師微妙覺，　聞已生歡喜，　　即詣如來所。
translation: I will hear that the Buddha has come, the great teacher Subtle and Wonderful Enlightenment, and rejoice when I hear that, and I'll go to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 既見世間燈，　　能持流炬者，　從輅投身下，　　足步至尊前；　頂禮佛雙足，　　深心極喜悅，　退坐於一面，　　瞻仰大慈尊，　無量人天類，　　恭敬而圍遶。
translation: Having seen the lamp of the world, the bearer of the portable torch plunged down from the bottom of his feet, stepped forward to reach the Bhagavān, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, became profoundly delighted, withdrew to sit at one side, looked up to the greatly compassionate Bhagavān, and was surrounded by measureless humans and gods in respect.

source_sentence: 世尊如是告：　　『汝斷諸纏縛；　無上天尊師，　　慈悲故來此。』
translation: The Bhagavān thus addressed them, 'You have ended the bonds of bondage; the unsurpassed gods are here because of their compassion.'

source_sentence: 為說四諦法，　　聞者能開悟。
translation: He teaches the Dharma of the four truths, and those who hear it will be enlightened.

source_sentence: 我聞如是請：　　『唯正覺世尊，　願許我出家，　　近住成圓具。』
translation: I heard this invitation, 'Only the Bhagavān, the World Honored One, would you grant me permission to leave home and become fully ordained in your near abode?'

source_sentence: 無上大慈父，　　無有等等者，　哀愍命善來，　　言下成圓具；　精進不放逸，　　苦行而修習，　即證無生位，　　得入涅槃宮。
translation: 'Unsurpassed, great father of compassion, there's no equal, compassionately ordering a good arrival to become fully ordained by his words, making effort without laziness, and cultivating painful practices, I'll realize the status of nonarising and enter the palace of nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 親侍大導師，　　無上等正覺，　證得阿羅漢，　　除熱得清涼；　能脫三有海，　　漂流生死河，　一切憂悲苦，　　由斯永得除。
translation: He serves the great guide, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, realizes the state of arhat, rids himself of fever, and attains coolness; he's able to escape the ocean of the three existences, drift down the river of birth and death, and is thus permanently freed from all grief and sorrow.

source_sentence: 火生之苾芻，　　對斯真聖眾，　說自昔作業，　　無熱大池中，　安坐蓮花臺。」
translation: The fiery-born monk told this truly noble assembly about their past activities, and he sat comfortably on a lotus-flower dais in a large, unheated pond."

source_sentence: 爾時諸大聲聞耆宿苾芻告具壽護國曰：「具壽火生已說本業，次至仁說。」
translation: It was then that the great śrāvaka senior monks addressed Kauśāmbī, saying, "Kauśāmbī has already explained his past actions, and next, he'll explain them to you."

source_sentence: 爾時護國苾芻即說頌言：「昔有王名吉基利，　　迦尸國主饒益人；　我身是王最小子，　　為佛造大窣覩波。
translation: It was then that the monk Protecting the Nation spoke in verse, saying, "Once upon a time, there was a king named Jikili, the lord of Kāśyapa, who gave benefits to people; I myself was the king's youngest child, and I created a great stūpa for the Buddha.

source_sentence: 父王令其最小子，　　躬持傘蓋奉如來；　我聞王勅心歡喜，　　安置寶蓋窣覩波。
translation: My father told his youngest son to carry his umbrella and present it to the Tathāgata; when I heard the king's order, my heart rejoiced and I placed the jeweled canopy over the stūpa.

source_sentence: 既安蓋已便發願，　　由斯善業因緣故；　天上人間招快樂，　　常有最勝大光明。
translation: Once I had placed the canopy, I then vowed that because of the causes and conditions of this good action, pleasure would come to gods and humans, and the most excellent great light would always be available.

source_sentence: 今生最後於人趣，　　降誕倉庫大城中；　既生最勝豪族舍，　　世間尊貴而第一。
translation: Now, having been born in the final destiny of humans, he's descended into the great city of Warehouse, and having been born in the most distinguished and powerful family home, he's honored as the most distinguished in the world.

source_sentence: 見者歡喜常恭敬，　　一切國人皆慶悅。
translation: Those who see it rejoice and always venerate it, and all the people of that country rejoice.

source_sentence: 殊勝果報隨身現，　　色相端嚴心安靜，　人間受用悉充足，　　一切所須無乏少。
translation: Their excellent rewards are displayed on their person, their appearance is dignified, their mind is peaceful, and they have plenty of human possessions, and there's nothing they lack.

source_sentence: 護國苾芻對尊宿，　　說自昔報業因緣。」
translation: The monks who protect the country tell the venerable elder about the causes and conditions of past karma."

source_sentence: 爾時諸大聲聞耆宿苾芻告具壽娑底曰：「具壽護國已說業報，次至仁說。」
translation: It was then that the great śrāvaka senior monks addressed Kauśānti, "Kauśānti has already explained the results of his actions in protecting the country, and next he'll explain them to Ren."

source_sentence: 爾時具壽娑底即說頌曰：「昔於王舍城，　　王臣大富貴；　五百仙人至，　　皆令共供養。
translation: It was then that Kauśānti spoke a verse, "Once upon a time in Rājagṛha, the king's ministers were so wealthy and powerful that five hundred sages arrived and made offerings to them all.

source_sentence: 當時我宣教，　　普令先造食；　家中種種飯，　　給五百仙人，　次第分與我。
translation: At the time, I preached and instructed them to make food first, giving various kinds of rice to the 500 sages in their homes and distributing it to me in order.

source_sentence: 我既為尊首，　最初仙供養，　　我家恒營辦，　作飯百杓餘；　　於彼出家人，　將此飯供給。
translation: Now that I'm the venerable leader and the first sage makes offerings, my family always makes a hundred ladles of rice; that's the rice that's offered to the renunciant.

source_sentence: 既施飯食已，　生貪作是念：　　『我姊妹兄弟、　妻男女親族，　　尚不施飯食；　此仙三月坐，　　當有用度多，　況於五百數。
translation: After he gave them food, he became greedy and thought, 'My sisters, brothers, wives, sons, and relatives still don't give food, but this sage who sits for three months will have plenty to spare, so why wouldn't he give it to 500 people?'

source_sentence: 我須彼沙門，　令其得命終；　　若得彼身死，　我即無用度。』
translation: I need that ascetic to make sure he lives to the end of his life; if I were to let him die physically, I wouldn't have any use for him.'

source_sentence: 無過殺於彼，　及生罪心已，　　煎煮其馬尿，　和食與彼飡。
translation: Without fail, after killing him and incurring a sinful thought, I boiled his horse's urine and gave it to him for food.

source_sentence: 當喫此食已，　乃即有病患，　　便即腸肚出。
translation: After eating this food, they then become ill and their intestines and stomachs immediately escape.

source_sentence: 其時知死已，　　彼仙得道人。
translation: Knowing that he's dead, he's an immortal who has attained the Way.

source_sentence: 于時龍神等，　　皆共大聲語：『大罪是商人，　　無過枉殺仙，　得自在獨覺，　　寂靜無漏者。』
translation: The dragons and gods then all spoke aloud together, saying, 'That's a great crime for a businessman, no greater than killing an immortal in vain and attaining unimpeded solitary awakening, tranquility, and the absence of contaminants.'

source_sentence: 諸親皆瞋我，　　皆於當觀察，　能生多罪業，　　為殺彼仙故。
translation: All of my relatives are angry with me, and they're all about to examine the many sins that can be committed in order to kill those sages.

source_sentence: 聞親說語已，　　我即起愁悲；　請餘諸仙人，　　極生悔其過。
translation: After hearing what my relatives said, I immediately became sad and compassionate, and I asked the other sages to repent their faults with all my heart.

source_sentence: 對諸佛懺悔，　　現過心悔已；　飯供五百仙，　　珍重令充足；　懺其彼罪業，　　懺過於諸仙。
translation: After repenting to the buddhas and repenting of their faults, I offered food to 500 sages, valued it and made it plentiful, confessed their sins, and repented of their faults to the sages.

source_sentence: 以食供養已，　　即當發誓願：『當來願如是，　　供養此大德；　如所得解脫，　　願我亦離縛；　生生離貧家，　　莫在貧窮處。』
translation: After making an offering of food, he then vows, 'Thus will I wish to make offerings to this great virtuous person in the future; as I attain liberation, may I also be freed from bondage; born into a poor family, I won't be in a poor place.'

source_sentence: 忽常起慳貪，　　令心發其惡；　捐彼獨覺人，　　作業即愁悲。
translation: Suddenly, he'll always become stingy and greedy, causing his mind to become evil; donating that solitary realizer's actions to grief.

source_sentence: 死後墮地獄，　　久住千年歲，　常受其苦痛；　　後得生人身，　還受短命報。
translation: After death, he'll fall into hell, stay there for a thousand years, and always suffer pain; later, when he's born as a human being, he'll again suffer the consequences of a short life.

source_sentence: 當有多財物，　供養於諸人；　　常患腸肚出，　因此即命終。
translation: He'll have a lot of possessions to offer to people, but his intestines and stomach will always leak out, and he'll die as a result.

source_sentence: 即生遇大聖，　乃獲出家體，　　依教而成住，　一切貪悉捨。
translation: He'll be born again, meet a great sage, attain renunciant status, become established according to the teachings, and abandon all craving.

source_sentence: 無熱蓮花座，　說本業因緣。」
translation: From his unheated lotus seat, he explains the causes and conditions of his past actions."

source_sentence: 爾時具壽耆宿苾芻告具壽膝多迦攝波曰：「具壽娑底已說業報，次至具壽說。」
translation: It was then that the Kauśāmbī Gṛdhrakūṭa regent addressed Kauśāmbī, "Kauśāmbī has already explained the results of karma, so next Kauśāmbī will explain it."

source_sentence: 于時膝多迦攝波即說頌曰：「往請苾芻眾，　　不闕於七年；　於其聚落內，　　時世為饑饉。
translation: Kauṣṭhakashyapa then spoke this verse, "I've invited a multitude of bhikṣus for no less than seven years, and in my village there's a time when the world is starving.

source_sentence: 我所得分者，　　心調意寂靜；　是獨覺所尊，　　無惱甚清涼。
translation: The person I've asked to come is calm in mind and thought, and he's honored by the pratyekabuddhas as being very cool and untroubled.

source_sentence: 我先有要誓，　　乞者而不與；　縱是子及親，　　非營作不濟。
translation: I had previously made a vow not to give it to a beggar, even if it were a son or relative, unless I worked to help them.

source_sentence: 如是發此意，　　遂為罪惡業；　苾芻既不作，　　何故而與食？
translation: Such a thought would be a bad and evil action; why would a monk give food to a beggar when he won't do it?

source_sentence: 即將此苾芻，　　經行於田處；　然始至家中，　　方與其飲食。
translation: He then takes this monk and walks him through the fields, only to give him food and drink when he arrives home.

source_sentence: 由斯惡業熟，　　遂墮於地獄；　眾活炎熱中，　　而受諸楚苦。
translation: As a result of this ripening bad karma, they'll fall into hell, where they'll live in the heat and experience pain and suffering.

source_sentence: 地獄業報盡，　　所生流轉趣；　鄙賤常憂苦，　　飡糧甚難得。
translation: When the results of hellish actions are ended, I'm born in a transmigration path; I'm always miserable and humble, and it's very difficult to get food.

source_sentence: 此是我最後，　　而獲於人身；　不虧調御士，　　正覺無上尊，　淨信而出家；　　蠲除諸有漏，　證得六神通，　　至於羅漢果。
translation: This is the last person I'll ever attain; I'll be no less a tamer, a perfectly enlightened and unsurpassed honored one, a pure believer who leaves home, freed from all the contaminants, attained the six supernormal powers, and reached the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 諸德當知我，　　雖證大神通；　經行甚難苦，　　方獲而飲食。
translation: You should know, O virtuous ones, that even though I realized great supernormal powers, I had to go through very difficult and painful travels before I could obtain food and drink.

source_sentence: 遊歷極遠處，　　遂有而少獲；　命將欲斷絕，　　時可得其食。
translation: I've traveled to very faraway places, and I've gotten very little; my life will soon end, but I'll be able to eat at some point.

source_sentence: 我姓膝迦攝，　　名為耳大威；　無熱蓮花坐，　　言斯先業緣。」
translation: My family name is Kekkaśa, and I'm called Ear Bodhisattva; I sit on a lotus without heat, and I say this is a condition of prior karma."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻告具壽周離槃陀迦曰：「具壽膝迦攝波已說業報，次至具壽說。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks addressed Cunda Cūḷapanthaka, "Cunda Kṛkarśepa has already explained the results of karma, and Cunda will tell them next."

source_sentence: 于時槃陀迦即說頌曰：「我於前生中，　　而為養猪者；　繫其猪口已，　　將渡至河邊。
translation: It was then that Pāṇḍaka spoke this verse, "In a previous life, I was a pig farmer. After I tied up the mouth of that pig, I was about to cross to the river.

source_sentence: 既到河中心，　　欲至於彼岸；　諸猪氣不通，　　因此皆命過。
translation: Once I reached the center of the river, I wanted to reach the other side, but the pigs' inhalation didn't work, so their lives were all cut short.

source_sentence: 我隨水漂沒，　　荒迷無所為；　河邊有仙住，　　哀愍所救濟。
translation: I've been drowning in the water, lost in the wilderness, and have nothing to do; there are sages living at the river's edge who are compassionate and rescue me.

source_sentence: 出我溺憂苦，　　而為與出家；　以無相三昧，　　教化令調順。
translation: He frees me from the misery of drowning and gives me refuge, teaching and taming me with the formless samādhi.

source_sentence: 既於此滅已，　　得生於天上；　天上纔捨命，　　下生於人趣。
translation: Once this has ceased, he'll be born up in heaven; up in heaven, he'll surrender his life and be born down in a human rebirth.

source_sentence: 虔恭等正覺，　　捨俗為出家；　頑愚極暗鈍，　　示敬不能持。
translation: Pious and perfectly enlightened people renounce conventionality and become renunciant monks, but stubborn foolish people are so dull that they can't show respect for them.

source_sentence: 於其三月內，　　方能誦一偈；　既明一句義，　　煩惱欲悉除。
translation: Within three months, I was able to recite a single verse, and once I understood the meaning of that single phrase, my afflictions and desires were all removed.

source_sentence: 我先所造業，　　如是思憶念；　經於無量時，　　輪迴生死海。
translation: This is the kind of thought that recalls the actions I created in the past, which have passed through measureless time and been reincarnated in the ocean of birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 對於世間父，　　於此無熱池；　我周利槃馱，　　說斯黑白業。」
translation: For my worldly father, there's no hot tub here; I circumambulate Pūrṇa-dhvaja and explain this black-and-white activity."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻告具壽蛇僕：「具壽周利槃陀迦已說業報，次至具壽說。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks and nuns addressed the servant of the snake Kauśāmbī, "Kauśāmbī has already explained the results of karma, so let's next go to Kauśāmbī and explain it."

source_sentence: 于時蛇僕即說頌曰：「迦攝佛滅度，　　最後為聲聞；　多聞備三藏，　　於法甚慳悋。
translation: The serpent-servant then spoke a verse, saying, "Kāśyapa Buddha died, and he ended up as a direct disciple; he's well-versed in the Tripiṭaka, but he's stingy with the Dharma.

source_sentence: 不為諸苾芻，　　諷誦而解說；　恐餘諸苾芻，　　而有勝於我。
translation: He wouldn't recite or explain it to any monk, lest some other monk might surpass me.

source_sentence: 苾芻詣我所，　　欲求問少義；　我為懷惡色，　　訶詰而不理。
translation: Those monks come to me, wanting to ask about a little doctrine, and I reprimand them for harboring bad looks and ignoring them.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻來，　　諫責我斯見；　何不治法化，　　作斯非理事。
translation: The monks then came and rebuked me for this view; why didn't they govern the Dharma and teach it, creating this kind of improper principle?

source_sentence: 我於臨終時，　　情生極追悔；　所閑真妙法，　　不為他顯示。
translation: When I was about to die, I felt deep remorse; I didn't reveal for others the true and wonderful Dharma that I had recited.

source_sentence: 命唯有七日，　　時轉不久停；　宜集出家士，　　悔謝諸過咎。
translation: With only seven days to live and no time to lose, it's appropriate to gather renunciant monks to repent of their faults.

source_sentence: 我既悔罪已，　　息其慳法心；　即於大眾中，　　七日常說法。
translation: Once I had repented of my sins, I stopped being stingy with the Dharma and preached among the masses for seven days.

source_sentence: 既聞善說法，　　隨我皆聽受；　互相為解釋，　　咸共而談論。
translation: Having heard the good teaching, they all listened to me, explained it to each other, and discussed it together.

source_sentence: 我緣臨終時，　　七日說妙法；　而得生天上，　　諸欲悉具足。
translation: At the time of my death, I spoke the wonderful Dharma for seven days and was born up in heaven, where all desires are fulfilled.

source_sentence: 天上捨報盡，　　下生於人趣；　而生劫比羅，　　釋迦王族中。
translation: When the rewards of indifference in heaven have ended, I'm born down in a human rebirth, and I'm born among the family of King Kappila or the Śākya clan.

source_sentence: 資財大富貴，　　容儀甚可樂；　人眾皆敬愛，　　資產無有乏。
translation: Their possessions are great, their manners are delightful, and they're beloved by everyone, with no lack of possessions.

source_sentence: 種族諸男女，　　捨俗而出家；　我為惱欲纏，　　而無欣樂意。
translation: Men and women of that clan abandon the worldly life and leave home, and I'm tormented by desire, but I'm not pleased.

source_sentence: 無比大丈夫，　　為欲哀愍故；　頻至於我所，　　誨勸令出家。
translation: No greater man, out of pity for those who want to help, comes to me often, teaching and encouraging them to leave home.

source_sentence: 我即稽調御，　　無上等正覺；　唯願七年中，　　哀愍受壇施。
translation: I then [will] agree to be disciplined, unsurpassed, and perfectly enlightened, wishing that for seven years I would compassionately accept the altar as a gift.

source_sentence: 若見受其施，　　七年將過已；　即隨大慧所，　　方可為出家。
translation: If he sees and accepts his gift, then after seven years have passed, he'll follow the great wisdom and then he'll be allowed to leave home.

source_sentence: 告我命危脆，　　不暫豈七年；　宜當急捨施，　　出入息難保。
translation: I'm told my life is too fragile to last more than seven years; I should hastily relinquish my alms, for it's difficult to keep my breath when I leave and enter.

source_sentence: 佛語深尊重，　　豈敢而棄捨；　白言七日內，　　哀愍與出家。
translation: The Buddha's words were so profound and respectful, how could I dare to abandon them? I said, "Within seven days, I'll sympathize with you and leave home.

source_sentence: 即於七日中，　　隨意皆資給；　於其城內外，　　諸親咸守擁。
translation: During those seven days, he provided for them as he pleased, and his relatives both inside and outside the city embraced him.

source_sentence: 最上大光明，　　遍耀於城墎；　不思議人眾，　　得出於城外。
translation: The supreme great light shines everywhere in the city's city wall, and the inconceivable multitude of people are able to escape from outside the city.

source_sentence: 於佛法教中，　　淨信為出家；　於二十五年，　　心無有正悟。
translation: Among the teachings of the Buddha, pure faith becomes renunciant; for twenty-five years, his mind had no correct awakening.

source_sentence: 遂即罪心起，　　不欲依此住；　莫能至甘露，　　宜退且還家。
translation: Then, his sinful thoughts arose, and he didn't want to stay here; since he couldn't reach the nectar of Buddhahood, it was time to retire and return home.

source_sentence: 既生此怯懼，　　深懷大羞恥；　諸親及家眷，　　定為譏誚我。
translation: Having become frightened of this, I'm deeply ashamed; my relatives and family members will surely revile me.

source_sentence: 所念非相類，　　審知不善事；　我宜以刀害，　　何用此殘活？
translation: Their thoughts are not similar, and they know they're doing something unwholesome; I should kill them with a sword, why should I use this to save my life?

source_sentence: 即持極利刀，　　跏趺而端坐；　安刀於頭上，　　心即得解脫。
translation: He then takes his extremely sharp sword, sits cross-legged, and places it on his head, and his mind is liberated.

source_sentence: 心既得蠲除，　　口口而稱讚；　奇哉佛法僧，　　有斯勝善法。
translation: Once his mind is freed, he praises it with his mouth, "Amazing, Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha, to have such excellent and good qualities.

source_sentence: 我先有思想，　　凡夫便捨壽；　不顧其性命，　　證得無上寂。
translation: When I first had thought, ordinary people then gave up their lives; regardless of their lives, they realized unsurpassed quiescence.

source_sentence: 我於先有中，　　懶惰極慳法；　由斯果報故，　　艱難得解脫。
translation: In my prior existence, I was lazy and extremely stingy, and because of this result, it was difficult to attain liberation.

source_sentence: 又我於臨終，　　為說淨妙法；　由斯業成熟，　　超除諸財欲。
translation: When I was about to die, I taught him the pure and wonderful Dharma; because of this maturation of karma, I was freed from the desire for possessions.

source_sentence: 法根釋迦子，　　蛇奴大威德；　於其無熱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: The Dharma root of Śākyamuni's son, the serpent slave of great authority, explains the results of such prior actions in the absence of a hot pool."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻又告具壽阿泥盧馱曰：「具壽蛇奴已說業報，次至具壽。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks and nuns also addressed Aniruddha Goswami, "Goswami Snake-nu has already explained the results of his actions, so he'll go on to Goswami Goswami."

source_sentence: 于時阿泥盧馱即說頌曰：「我先無攝錄，　　貧窮負草活；　歸投備名稱，　　奉覲大沙門。
translation: Aniruddha then spoke a verse, saying, "In the past, I didn't have a record, so I was poor and had to work with grass. I returned, prepared a name, and paid respect to the great ascetics.

source_sentence: 今生釋迦種，　　名阿泥嚧馱；　善閑歌舞伎，　　能於諸妙曲。
translation: Now I've been born into the Śākyas' lineage, and I'm called *Aniruddha*, a singer and dancer who's good at performing marvelous music.

source_sentence: 希逢大導師，　　無畏等正覺；　見已心清淨，　　捨俗而出家。
translation: I've met a great teacher, the fearless and perfectly enlightened one, whose vision purifies my mind, so I abandon the worldly world and leave home.

source_sentence: 得聞所說教，　　樂住大師處；　情無暫放逸，　　常自勤策勇。
translation: After hearing what he teaches, he enjoys staying at the site of the great teacher, never becomes careless in his thoughts, and always endeavors to do so.

source_sentence: 三明具獲已，　　大師教已作；　觀知於宿命，　　所曾之事業。
translation: After fully acquiring the three insights, he has completed the great teacher's teaching, observing and knowing the past lives and undertakings he has undertaken.

source_sentence: 於三十三天，　　七返而受生；　七返生人趣，　　亦為作人主。
translation: In the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, he'll be reborn seven times, and seven times he'll go to the destinies of men, where he'll also be the lord of men.

source_sentence: 灌頂剎帝利，　　獨化於贍部；　彼七此亦七，　　輪迴十四返；　曾住受用處，　　咸皆知其所。
translation: The consecrating bodhisattva alone transforms a group of jīva; these seven and this one is also seven, and they reincarnate fourteen times; they all know the places where they once lived and enjoyed their function.

source_sentence: 此類諸果報，　　無有而不悉；　我於所生處，　　情極甚歡喜。
translation: There are no rewards like these that aren't already known, and I'm extremely happy where I've been born.

source_sentence: 觀知諸有情，　　生死輪迴趣，　此變於餘現，　　一心繫思念。
translation: I observe and know the transmigration through birth and death of all sentient beings, and I fix my thoughts on these transformations and other manifestations with a single thought.

source_sentence: 五趣輪迴事，　　天眼皆明了，　已獲安詳道，　　天眼甚明淨。
translation: The divine eye discerns the five transmigration destinies, and it has attained a peaceful path with the divine eye of great clarity.

source_sentence: 世間無上師，　　知我念所念，　佛身意神通，　　而來於我所；　我所有思念，　　而能增上說。
translation: There's no supreme teacher in the world who knows what I think, whose supernormal power of buddha's body and mind comes to me, and who can explain in detail what I think.

source_sentence: 大師無過咎，　　所說亦無非；　我聞彼所說，　　依教而淨住。
translation: "The great teacher is without fault, and what he teaches is not false; I hear what he teaches, rely on the teaching, and abide in purity.

source_sentence: 心生極精勤，　　常修不放逸；　三明已通達，　　所應作已作。
translation: With great diligence, I always cultivate it and don't let it slip; I've comprehended the three insights and have done what should be done.

source_sentence: 於生無有喜，　　於死亦無憂；　唯知待時至，　　正念住威儀。
translation: There's no joy in birth, and no sorrow in death; they only know when the time has come and correctly observe their dignity with mindfulness.

source_sentence: 廣嚴竹林村，　　命當於彼過；　於其竹林下，　　而欲取歸化。
translation: He'll pass through that vast and ornate bamboo grove village, and underneath it, he'll try to get converts.

source_sentence: 我先施食故，　　獲此殊妙果；　虔恭大導師，　　無比等正覺，　證得阿羅漢，　　清涼寂靜處；　諸見者記我，　　大福中為最。
translation: Because I first gave alms, I attained this marvelous fruit; I reverently adored the great teacher, peerless and perfectly enlightened; I realized arhatship, a place of cool serenity; and I'm remembered by those who see me as the most blessed of all.

source_sentence: 此阿泥盧馱，　　對佛苾芻僧，　於無熱河中，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: This Aniruddha told these Buddhist monks and nuns the results of their prior actions in the river of no heat."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻又告具壽師子王迦羅苾芻：「具壽阿泥盧馱已說業報，次至具壽說。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks also addressed Kālā, the lion king of Kauśāmbī, saying, "Kauśāmbī Aniruddha has already explained the results of karma, so let's next go to Kauśāmbī and explain it."

source_sentence: 于時迦羅即說頌曰：「我先押甘蔗，　　至於煎糖室；　時有病獨覺，　　徐行來我所。
translation: Kālā then spoke a verse, saying, "I first betrayed sugarcane and went to the sugar refinery. Then a sick loner slowly made his way to my place.

source_sentence: 於其七日內，　　糖油常奉侍；　於其七日後，　　獨覺昇空去。
translation: During those seven days, he was always served sugar and oil; after those seven days, he alone realized that he had risen into the sky and departed.

source_sentence: 我緣出不在，　　奴便啟我言；　有斯勝福田，　　比受家中供。
translation: When I was out and away, the slave then told me, "This is a superior field of merit, which is better than accepting offerings from home.

source_sentence: 我既聞斯說，　　情生極淨信；　速往昇空處，　　深為欽敬仰。
translation: After hearing that, I had an extremely pure faith, quickly went to ascend to emptiness, and profoundly venerated him.

source_sentence: 往因發淨心，　　又緣施油糖；　天上人間趣，　　具福心明朗。
translation: The cause of my pure intention was to go there, and the condition was to give oil and sugar; I was blessed and clear-eyed for the destinies of heaven and humans.

source_sentence: 此為最後生，　　亦得作人身；　虔恭大導師，　　無比等正覺。
translation: This is the last birth, and I've been made a human being, reverently respecting the great teacher, who's peerless and perfectly enlightened.

source_sentence: 於大釋師教，　　希得為出家；　證獲阿羅漢，　　清涼寂靜處。
translation: Attaining the great teacher of the Śākyas, he hopes to become a renunciant; he'll realize the state of an arhat, a place of tranquility and calm.

source_sentence: 我今極獲安，　　利養甚豐多；　衣食及臥具，　　湯藥無所乏。
translation: Now, I've attained the utmost peace, and my support is abundant; there's nothing lacking in clothing, food, bedding, or medicine.

source_sentence: 我以少緣事，　　要須四團糖；　欲施縫衣者，　　糖將興供養。
translation: For a few reasons, I need four lumps of sugar; I want to give it to someone who wants to sew clothes, and the sugar will be an offering.

source_sentence: 諸天知我念，　　即告影勝王；　宜速施迦羅，　　沙糖清涼漿。
translation: The gods knew my thoughts and told King Yama that it would be a good idea to quickly give Kālā a cool, refreshing syrup of sugar.

source_sentence: 由斯施漿故，　　王獲大勝利；　宜使侍縛迦，　　齎菴羅及糖。
translation: Because of this offering of syrup, the king will attain great victory; so he should send an attendant to Vakkula to carry the amla and sugar.

source_sentence: 即遣四大象，　　馱齎真美味；　影勝大福王，　　令送於我所。
translation: He then sent four large elephants to carry the delicious food, and the king of great merit, Yōshō, ordered them to deliver it to me.

source_sentence: 王既令使送，　　我得此甘糖；　供給千二百，　　五十苾芻僧。
translation: Now that the king has sent his messengers, I've obtained this sweet sugar to offer to twelve hundred and fifty monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 迦羅阿羅漢，　　具六大神通；　於無熱河中，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: The Kālā arhat, who possesses the six great supernormal powers, spoke of the effects of this prior act in the river of no heat."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻又告具壽羅怙羅曰：「具壽迦羅已說業報，次至具壽。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks and nuns also addressed Rāhula, "Gosshū Kālā has already explained the results of karma, and he'll go on to Gosshū next."

source_sentence: 于時羅怙羅即說頌曰：「我作先國王，　　在於廣嚴都；　發朝依正化，　　令眾皆安益。
translation: Rāhula then spoke a verse, saying, "I was the king of a former country, and I was in the capital of Vairocana, relying on right transformation in the morning to bring peace to all people.

source_sentence: 時有一仙來，　　威德甚雄猛；　詣至於我所，　　便發如是言：『我今是盜賊，　　不與水而飲；　請王准賊法，　　依教科罰我。』
translation: Then, an immortal of great authority and majesty came to me and said, 'Now, I'm a thief who doesn't drink from water, so I'd like the king to punish me according to the thief's rules.'

source_sentence: 我即報彼言：　　『仙若法德備，　泉井河江水，　　許隨意而飲。
translation: I then told him, 'If the sage's qualities were complete, he might allow me to drink from a spring, well, or river as I like.'

source_sentence: 我所懷疑惑，　　不能悉蠲除；　願見王罰罪，　　我即無思慮。』
translation: I have doubts and confusions that can't all be removed, and I wish to see the king punish me for my crimes, so I won't have to think about them.'

source_sentence: 即告彼仙曰：　　『宜入芳園中；　六日不應食，　　已後任隨去。』
translation: He then told the sage, 'It's better to go into the fragrant garden; you shouldn't eat for six days, and then you can leave as you like.'

source_sentence: 我所作此業，　　實無有惡意；　黑繩炎熱中，　　六十年受苦。
translation: 'There's really no ill will in what I've done, and I've suffered 60 years of suffering under the heat of a black rope.

source_sentence: 業報盡後身，　　六年在母胎；　此實無心造，　　亦無身口業。
translation: After the results of my actions are ended, I spend six years in my mother's womb; I really didn't create this action with my mind, nor did I do any physical or verbal actions.

source_sentence: 由此因緣故，　　而受諸苦果；　耆宿眾前說，　　當知業不亡。
translation: As a result of these causes and conditions, I'll experience the results of suffering; I've been told by a multitude of elders that I should know that my actions won't die.

source_sentence: 此是羅怙羅，　　對於諸尊者；　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先惡業。」
translation: This is Rāhula, speaking to the venerables, telling them about this prior bad action at the pool of no-hot affliction."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻又告具壽難陀曰：「具壽羅怙羅已說業報，次至具壽。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks also addressed Kanakananda, "After telling him about the results of his actions, Rāhula next comes Kanakananda."

source_sentence: 于時難陀即說頌曰：「毘鉢尸佛教，　　時我設香湯；　洗浴苾芻僧，　　便發如是語：『願我當來世，　　及諸如是眾，　清淨無瑕垢，　　煩惱漏皆除；　容儀得端正，　　顏色過蓮花。』
translation: Nanda then spoke a verse, "Vipaśyin Buddha, when I prepared this fragrant bath, I washed the monks and gave them a bath and then said, 'May I and all such people in a future life be pure and spotless, with all the afflictive contaminants removed, and have a manner so correct that it's more beautiful than a lotus flower.'

source_sentence: 其時命既過，　　得生於天上；　天上甚超絕，　　人趣亦殊妙；　隨所生流處，　　恒安常富貴。
translation: When their lives have passed, they're born up in the heavens, where they're quite extraordinary and their human destinies are also marvelous; wherever they're born, they're constantly at ease and prosperous.

source_sentence: 後持獨覺身，　　起塔鮮白淨；　嚴飾塗香已，　　黃色而覆上，　[跍*月]跪合掌言：　　『當願諸根具；　身相如金色，　　善持而不變。』
translation: Holding the body of the pratyekabuddha, he raises a stūpa that's bright white and pure, finely decorates it with incense, and then covers it with a yellow color. [Khaṇḍa*moon] He kneels down and joins his palms, saying, 'May all your faculties be complete, and your body's features will be like gold, well-maintained and unchanging.'

source_sentence: 由此善根故，　　生波羅痆斯；　與迦陀國王，　　而為第二子。
translation: Because of these good roots, he was born in Pārāṇasī and became the second son of the king of Kāśyapa.

source_sentence: 又見迦攝塔，　　虔恭生淨意；　於其此塔中，　　而懸一傘蓋。
translation: Seeing the Kāśyapa stūpa, he reverently cultivates a pure intention, and in that stūpa he hangs an umbrella.

source_sentence: 由先浴眾僧，　　塗塔黃色因；　施塔傘蓋故，　　多獲諸安樂。
translation: Because he had first bathed the saṃgha and painted the stūpa yellow in color, he was able to attain many comforts as a result of giving the stūpa an umbrella.

source_sentence: 由斯餘福業，　　於其最後身；　生釋迦王族，　　與如來為弟。
translation: As a result of these other meritorious actions, in his final body he was born into the Śākyamuni royal family and became a disciple of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 我今於此身，　　具備大丈夫；　三十殊妙相，　　而無欠闕者。
translation: Now, in this body, I'm a fully endowed great being with thirty marvelous features, none of which are missing.

source_sentence: 釋迦師子教，　　而我得出家；　證極阿羅漢，　　除熱獲清涼。
translation: I was taught by the Śākyamuni lion, and I became a householder, realizing the ultimate arhat and ridding myself of fever to attain coolness.

source_sentence: 蒙佛記於我，　　端嚴甚可樂；　我生皆已盡，　　至於無上處。
translation: I've been remembered by the Buddha as a most delightful, dignified being who has ended all my births and reached the supreme place.

source_sentence: 此善者難陀，　　對佛苾芻眾；　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: This good man Nandanavana told this crowd of Buddhist monks about the effects of prior actions in a lake without heat or trouble."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻告具壽實力子曰：「具壽難陀已說業報，次至具壽。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks addressed Kauśāmbīpa, saying, "Kauśāmbīpa Nandāna has already explained the results of karma, and he'll reach Kauśāmbīpa next."

source_sentence: 于時實力子即說頌曰：「我於前身時，　　名捕魚商旅；　因興易進發，　　有仙來伴去。
translation: Gupta then spoke a verse, saying, "In a former life, I was called a fisherman and traveler. I was motivated and easily motivated by the presence of sages who came and went with me.

source_sentence: 是真大獨覺，　　漏盡心無礙；　我相見中間，　　常請受微供。
translation: This is the truly great pratyekabuddha, whose contaminants have ended and whose mind is unimpeded; I saw him in the midst of them and always asked him to accept modest offerings.

source_sentence: 隨其至宿處，　　為敷諸臥具；　洗足奉油塗，　　及與為然燈。
translation: He follows them to their lodging, spreads out bedding, washes their feet, rubs oil on them, and gives them a lamp.

source_sentence: 同比共為伴，　　虔心常供侍；　徐徐既前進，　　得至於海際。
translation: Sharing the same company, they devoutly and always make offerings; slowly advancing, they reach the end of the ocean.

source_sentence: 既至於海際，　　我即前跪曰：『大德有何緣，　　故來於此處？
translation: Once we reached the ocean's edge, I knelt down and said, 'What are the reasons, Mañjuśrī, for coming to this place?'

source_sentence: 我等皆欲纏，　　不辭諸苦惱；　入於險難處，　　無涯大海聚。』
translation: 'We all want to be tethered, so we won't resist suffering and distress; we'll enter a place of danger and difficulty, where the ocean is endless and numerous.'

source_sentence: 彼言我除惱，　　願汝常安樂；　生生備大福，　　多財無所乏。
translation: They say, 'I will remove your afflictions and wish you constant happiness, great happiness in your birth, and plenty of possessions that have no lack.'

source_sentence: 我即以上衣，　　齎持而奉施；　頭面禮敬足，　　虔心而右繞。
translation: I then took these robes, carried them, and offered them to you, paid homage with my head and feet, and reverently circled to my right.

source_sentence: 彼哀愍我故，　　受我所奉衣；　諸旅咸瞻仰，　　便昇於虛空。
translation: Because of their pity for me, they accepted the robe I offered them, and the travelers all looked up to me as they ascended into the sky.

source_sentence: 諸旅覩神通，　　我即懷悲惱；　虔躬遙合掌，　　作如是發願：『如是大尊德，　　願我常相遇；　其所得妙法，　　願我亦證悟。
translation: Seeing the travelers' superknowledge, I immediately felt compassion for them, bowed my head with my palms together, and made this vow, 'May I always meet such a great venerable, and may I also realize the wonderful Dharma that I've attained.

source_sentence: 當來得值佛，　　而得為出家；　供養僧伽眾，　　發起大神通。』
translation: In the future, I'll meet the Buddha, become a renunciant, make offerings to the Saṃgha, and give rise to great supernormal powers.'

source_sentence: 由此善根故，　　天上常歡樂；　亦生於人趣，　　多受諸安泰。
translation: Because of these good roots, they'll always be happy up in the heavens and be born in a human destiny, where they'll often experience well-being.

source_sentence: 凡是諸生處，　　多財大富貴；　天上及人間，　　福德恒明朗。
translation: Where there's birth, there's plenty of wealth and great prosperity, and the merits of both heaven and humans are always bright and clear.

source_sentence: 從初受果報，　　此為最後身；　於拘尸那城，　　得為壯士子。
translation: From the first fruition, this is the last body; in the city of Kuśinagara, he attains the status of a stalwart son.

source_sentence: 端正極可樂，　　顏容無有比；　人眾皆敬愛，　　得超大富際。
translation: His features are perfectly pleasing, his countenance is unsurpassed, he's beloved by everyone, and he has attained a great measure of wealth.

source_sentence: 希遇釋師子，　　無上等正覺；　見已心清淨，　　捨俗而出家。
translation: He meets the lion of Śākyamuni, the unsurpassed perfectly enlightened one, and after seeing him, his mind is purified, and he leaves home to abandon the worldly life.

source_sentence: 依於竹林內，　　及處於山間；　聲聞眾來集，　　而惱苾芻僧。
translation: He found himself in a bamboo grove or in the mountains, where a multitude of śrāvakas gathered to trouble the monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 敷設臥具故，　　與苾芻說過；　或惱或譏誚，　　頻頻相呵責。
translation: As they spread out their bedding, they talked to the monks, sometimes criticizing or reviling them, and often rebuking them.

source_sentence: 具此諸梵行，　　我即起悲心；　時有我生盡，　　當為供侍者。
translation: With these religious practices, I immediately became compassionate; when there's an end to my birth, I'll be an attendant.

source_sentence: 而自常勤策，　　於教恒修習；　證得阿羅漢，　　具備六神通。
translation: Always striving on my own, I cultivate the teaching constantly; I realize the state of arhat and possess the six supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 詣於大師所，　　曲躬頭面禮；　合掌前恭敬，　　從無上乞願：『願見聽於我，　　供給苾芻僧；　不隨愛瞋癡，　　慈心皆平等。』
translation: Going to the great teacher, I bowed my head and face, put my palms together in front of me in respect, and vowed from the bottom of my heart, 'May I be heard to make offerings to the Bhikṣus, not following craving or delusion, but being equal in kindness.'

source_sentence: 大師知我意，　　默然受我請；　即令住寺內，　　對諸苾芻僧。
translation: The great teacher knew my intention, quietly accepted my invitation, and ordered me to stay inside the temple and address the monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 身為慈悲業，　　口意亦復然；　供給苾芻眾，　　低心常敬重。
translation: He did compassionate actions with his body, and likewise with his words and thoughts, making offerings to the multitude of monks and nuns and always honoring them with lowliness of heart.

source_sentence: 來去諸苾芻，　　及諸道行者；　我見甚歡喜，　　安慰而問訊。
translation: Those monks and practitioners of the path who come and go are delighted when I see them, and I greet them with comfort.

source_sentence: 五指放光明，　　如然大明炬；　敷設諸臥具，　　顯現大神通。
translation: I shine a bright light from my five fingers like a great torch, and I lay out my bedclothes, displaying great supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 我所有神變，　　苾芻欲見故；　時極將幽暗，　　方來於我所。
translation: Because of my miraculous powers, the monks want to see them, and it's going to be dark for a while before they come to me.

source_sentence: 次復續後來，　　慈心悉敬重；　為敷其臥具，　　不生恚念心。
translation: Then he followed up with a kind heart and full respect, laying out his bedding without malice.

source_sentence: 我先有思慮，　　我所有誓願；　清淨悉成辦，　　今皆得圓備。
translation: I had previously considered all my vows, and they were all accomplished in their purity, and now they've all been fulfilled.

source_sentence: 此實力聖子，　　漏盡心自在；　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: This is the strength of the noble son, whose mind is free from contaminants, and who speaks about the results of prior actions in a pool without burning distress."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻告具壽近將曰：「具壽實力子說業報已，次至具壽說。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks and nuns addressed the commander of Kauśāmbī, saying, "After Kauśāmbī has explained the results of his actions, then he'll go on to Kauśāmbī and explain them."

source_sentence: 于時近將即說頌曰：「我於往昔時，　　為獵者遊藪；　為求害麞鹿，　　持弓及毒箭，　尋山登峻險，　　夙夜常無倦。
translation: The commander then spoke a verse, saying, "In the past, I traveled to the marsh as a hunter; in order to harm wild deer, I carried a bow and poisoned arrow, scouted the mountains and ascended the steepest of dangers, and I never tired of working day and night.

source_sentence: 若逢禽獸時，　　情起殺害心，　彎弓放毒箭，　　射斷其命根。
translation: When I met a fowl or beast, my thoughts arose to kill it, so I bent my bow and loosed a poisoned arrow, cutting off its life.

source_sentence: 時我持弓箭，　　遊行於林藪，　見一大獨覺，　　住在於樹下；　我覩彼沙門，　　情生大忿恚，　彼無犯調寂，　　我以毒箭射。
translation: Armed with a bow and arrow, I was wandering through a forest and saw a great solitary realizer standing under a tree; when I saw that ascetic, I became very angry with him, and he didn't violate my tranquility, so I shot him with a poisoned arrow.

source_sentence: 既遭毒箭苦，　　甚受諸楚痛；　即於其樹下，　　捨有歸寂滅。
translation: After suffering from the poisoned arrow and experiencing terrible pain, I abandoned existence under that tree and returned to extinction.

source_sentence: 我由斯惡業，　　命終墮地獄；　經無量千歲，　　具受諸楚痛。
translation: Because of this bad action, I was sent to hell at the end of my life, where I spent measureless thousands of years and experienced terrible pain.

source_sentence: 地獄命既終，　　復受傍生趣；　山中遭害死，　　還墮於地獄。
translation: After my life in hell ends, I'll be reborn in an earlier rebirth; I'll be killed in the mountains and fall back into hell.

source_sentence: 生生恒怖畏，　　步步皆驚恐；　夙夜飢困苦，　　羸瘦甚憔悴。
translation: Their lives are constantly terrified, and they are frightened every step of the way; they suffer from hunger and hardship every night, and they become emaciated and thin.

source_sentence: 而常逢獵師，　　懷害雄猛者，　即以利毒箭，　　射我應時倒。
translation: I'm always confronted by a hunter who harms me and sends a sharp, poisonous arrow that strikes me down on cue.

source_sentence: 彼見我墮地，　　命在身搖動；　後以利刀截，　　分割肉將去。
translation: He sees me fall to the ground, and my life shakes within me; then he cuts me off with a sharp sword and slices off my flesh.

source_sentence: 如是五百生，　　多受諸苦惱。
translation: Thus, for 500 lifetimes, I'll often suffer many hardships.

source_sentence: 又於某方處，　　為求諸食故；　乃於其山下，　　見多大仙眾，　具修諸苦行，　　有大神威德；　我既覩仙眾，　　情便生慈念。
translation: Once I saw this multitude of sages cultivating ascetic practices and possessing great supernormal powers, I felt compassionate thoughts.

source_sentence: 漸漸心以慶，　　觀其大仙眾；　由此發清淨，　　得生於人趣。
translation: Gradually, my mind rejoiced as I looked at that multitude of great sages, and as a result, I purified myself and was born in a human destiny.

source_sentence: 遂見大獨覺，　　而來乞求食；　我即常奉請，　　就家受微供。
translation: Then I saw the great pratyekabuddha come begging for food, and I always invited him to come home and accept a modest offering.

source_sentence: 供養彼德已，　　合掌而發願：『願我當來世，　　常逢此尊師；　見佛生恭敬，　　而為作出家；　得生無所畏，　　斷除諸有漏。』
translation: After making offerings to their virtue, I put my palms together and vowed, 'May I always meet this venerable teacher in a future life, see the Buddha with respect, and make myself at home for him, be born without fear, and be freed from the contaminants.'

source_sentence: 由此善根故，　　得生於天上；　又生於人趣，　　大富具多財。
translation: Because of these good roots, I'll be born up in the heavens, and then I'll be born in a human destiny, where I'll be very wealthy and have lots of possessions.

source_sentence: 虔奉此大師，　　無比等正覺；　既見大牟尼，　　捨俗歸出家。
translation: Devoted to this great teacher, he's peerless and perfectly enlightened; having seen the great Muni, he left the secular world and became a renunciant.

source_sentence: 淨心既出家，　　深樂大師教；　我證阿羅漢，　　具六大神通。
translation: Once he left home with a pure heart, he deeply enjoyed the great teacher's teaching; I realized arhatship and possessed the six great supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 大德而我今，　　斷除諸結縛；　當入於山窟，　　方欲而受終。
translation: Now, Venerable, I've ended the bonds and fetters and will enter a mountain cave before I'm about to receive my final rebirth.

source_sentence: 當有磣毒蛇，　　來墮我身上；　此時我歸寂，　　是為證涅槃。
translation: When an unhappy viper comes along and falls on me, I return to extinction, which is the realization of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 諸德我思惟，　　先身所造業；　受無量果報，　　所作業不亡。
translation: I consider all the virtues, the actions created in my prior life, the immeasurable consequences I'll experience, and the actions I'll perform will not perish.

source_sentence: 此近將苾芻，　　對大僧伽眾，　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: This is the general monk who told this large assembly of monks about the results of prior actions in a pool of unafflicted water."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻告具壽賢子曰：「具壽近將已說業報，次至具壽說。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks addressed Kauśāmbī, the Bhagavān, saying, "Kauśāmbī has spoken about the results of actions in the near future, so he'll speak about them next."

source_sentence: 于時賢子即說頌曰：「昔時極飢儉，　　大怖皆幽闇；　時有五百人，　　求乞而濟活。
translation: The good son then spoke a verse, saying, "In the past, there was great hunger and famine, and great fear was darkness; there were 500 people who asked for alms to save their lives.

source_sentence: 我為眾中首，　　而與作導師；　彼乞得食已，　　咸來奉於我。
translation: I was the leader of them all and gave them guidance; after they had obtained food to beg, they all came to me to serve me.

source_sentence: 或精或麁食，　　常濟供承我；　不懷諸惡意，　　依我教而住。
translation: Whether it's fine or crude food, they always help and serve me; harboring no ill will, they abide according to my teaching.

source_sentence: 時有人在市，　　持煎餅而賣；　我即強奪取，　　走出於市外。
translation: When a man was in the marketplace, he was selling fried bread; I forcibly seized it and walked out of the marketplace.

source_sentence: 衝突向前走，　　餅主隨後逐；　我便迅疾去，　　莫能擒得我。
translation: He went forward in conflict, and the bread-holder chased after him; so I swiftly went away, and no one could catch me.

source_sentence: 急渡於大河，　　一邊而安住；　四面遙顧望，　　不見有人來。
translation: I hurriedly crossed the large river, but I stayed at one side; I looked around and saw no one coming.

source_sentence: 欲飡其煎餅，　　多膩甚精味；　我作如是念：　　『今日應飽滿。』
translation: I wanted to eat this cake, which was so oily and delicious, and I thought, 'Today I'll have enough.'

source_sentence: 時有大威仙，　　急來於我所；　是大獨覺尊，　　諸根甚寂靜。
translation: Then a great, mighty sage rushed to me, a great, uniquely enlightened honored one whose faculties are quite calm.

source_sentence: 我便作是念：　　『貧苦最為楚；　由先不修福，　　今獲飢窮報。
translation: I then thought, 'Poverty and suffering are the most painful; because I didn't cultivate goodness in the past, I've now been rewarded with hunger and poverty.'

source_sentence: 今宜精味餅，　　奉施此沙門；　寧可受飢死，　　不用貧苦活。』
translation: Now, I should offer this ascetic a delicious cake; I'd rather suffer starvation and die than live in poverty.'

source_sentence: 便發志誠心，　　深生清淨意；　即持其煎餅，　　奉上勝福田。
translation: Then he arouses a sincere resolve and gives rise to a profoundly pure intention; he takes these boiled cakes and presents them to a superior field of merit.

source_sentence: 大師受我施，　　對我前而食；　欲哀愍我故，　　便昇於虛空。
translation: Accepting my gift, the teacher ate it in front of me, and because he wanted to take pity on me, he ascended into space.

source_sentence: 我即合掌禮，　　『願我無窮報；　當生大豪族，　　顏色得端嚴。
translation: I then bowed my palms together and said, 'May my rewards be endless; I will be born into a great and powerful family, and my appearance will be dignified.'

source_sentence: 如是大德類，　　願常得相遇；　彼所證獲法，　　我亦當開悟。』
translation: May I always meet such a great class of virtuous people, and I will also be enlightened by the teaching they've realized.'

source_sentence: 由此善根故，　　多受諸快樂；　天上及人趣，　　端嚴甚光悅。
translation: Because of these good roots, they'll often experience pleasure, and their heavenly and human destinies will be dignified and resplendent.

source_sentence: 天上及人間，　　受勝大王報；　由斯施業故，　　不曾生惡趣。
translation: Up in heaven and among humans, they'll receive the rewards of a great king, and because of such generous actions, they won't be born in a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 復由殘業報，　　今於最後有；　得生大豪族，　　釋迦種望城。
translation: Again, because of the results of his cruelty, he'll now be born in his final lifetime to a great and powerful family, the city of Śākyamuni's hopes.

source_sentence: 於此後生中，　　而處於人身；　虔奉釋師子，　　無上等正覺。
translation: In this latter life, he'll be placed in a human body, devoting himself to Śāriputra, the unsurpassed, perfectly enlightened one.

source_sentence: 大德佛世尊，　　來過親族時；　我與諸親眷，　　捨俗而出家。
translation: "Venerable Buddha, when we passed through our clan, my relatives and I left home to become laymen.

source_sentence: 我先所有願，　　今皆已圓滿；　證獲阿羅漢，　　寂靜清涼處。
translation: Now, all my prior vows have been fulfilled, and I've realized the state of an arhat, a place of tranquility and coolness.

source_sentence: 王種而出家，　　是其佛種族；　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: This is the race of buddhas who leave home because of their royal lineage, and they speak of the results of their prior actions in a lake without burning distress."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻告具壽賢鹽曰：「具壽賢子已說業報，次至具壽說。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks and nuns addressed Kauśāmbīyan, "Kauśāmbīyan has already explained the results of his actions, so he'll next explain them to Kauśāmbī."

source_sentence: 于時賢鹽即說頌曰：「拘留孫佛時，　　有造彼佛塔；　時我為傭力，　　常與他雇作。
translation: Xianyan then spoke a verse, saying, "When Kauśāmbī was born, that Buddha's stūpa was built; at the time, I was a servant and always hired others to build it.

source_sentence: 作此塔之時，　　我頻出惡語：『何用斯大塔，　　豈有得成期？
translation: When I built that stūpa, I often said bad words, 'Why would I use such a huge stūpa, and how could it ever be completed?'

source_sentence: 塔宜微小作，　　不應廣費損；　省功無憂惱，　　而得速成就。』
translation: 'It's better to make small efforts than to expend large sums, saving effort and no sorrow, and then attaining speedy accomplishment.'

source_sentence: 由斯口業故，　　說此麁惡言；　臨終既命過，　　墮於地獄中。
translation: As a result of this verbal action, he spoke such harsh words; after his life is over, he'll fall into hell.

source_sentence: 地獄業報盡，　　於其所生處；　顏色極醜陋，　　人眾皆棄賤。
translation: When the results of their actions in hell are complete, they're born in a place that's extremely ugly and which people reject as beneath them.

source_sentence: 迦攝波佛時，　　為雄拘羅鳥；　依波羅痆斯，　　半道大林中。
translation: When Kāśyapa Buddha was born, he was a male koṭī bird that relied on the great forest halfway up the river in Pārāṇasī.

source_sentence: 其世大明燈，　　苾芻眾圍遶；　我出和雅音，　　於上右飛遶。
translation: It was a great bright lamp of the world, surrounded by multitudes of monks, and I produced a harmonious voice that flew up and around to the right.

source_sentence: 我凡見佛眾，　　而行乞食時；　出時及入時，　　常與右飛遶。
translation: When I see a multitude of buddhas and go begging for food, I always fly around with them to the right when I leave and enter.

source_sentence: 由斯善根故，　　得生於人趣；　虔奉調御士，　　無上等正覺，　釋迦師子法，　　而得為出家；　證悟阿羅漢，　　至寂清涼處。
translation: Because of these good roots, I was born in a human destiny; I'm a devout disciplinarian, an unsurpassed perfect enlightened one, a teacher of the Śākyas, and I became a renunciant; I realized arhatship and reached a place of quiescent coolness.

source_sentence: 於諸妙教中，　　佛記我為最；　多聞持法則，　　善音常演暢。
translation: Among the wondrous teachings, I'm the most memorable, well-versed in the principles of the Dharma and the constant dissemination of good sounds.

source_sentence: 四眾來我所，　　聽聞我說法；　天及諸有情，　　無不皆欽仰。
translation: Four multitudes come to hear me teach, and gods and other sentient beings alike all look up to me.

source_sentence: 先作善業少，　　為惡業極甚；　今獲其果報，　　當知業不亡。
translation: Having done little good deed in the past, I did very little bad deed; now I've reaped its fruit, and I know that my deeds will not perish.

source_sentence: 此賢鹽苾芻，　　對大僧伽眾，　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: This good monk told the great congregation of monks the results of their prior actions at the Lake of No Distress."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻告具壽蜜性曰：「具壽賢鹽已說業報，次至具壽說。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks addressed Kauśāmbī, saying, "Kauśāmbī has already explained the results of actions, so next Kauśāmbī will explain them."

source_sentence: 于時蜜性即說頌曰：「昔於廣嚴側，　　我為猴中主；　見多鉢在彼，　　我便持佛鉢。
translation: It was then that Honey Nature spoke a verse, saying, "Once upon a time, I was the lord of the monkeys near Vairocana; when I saw many bowls there, I carried the Buddha's bowl.

source_sentence: 諸苾芻見喝，　　世尊即告曰：『汝等諸苾芻，　　勿喝不損鉢。』
translation: When the monks saw it being drunk, the Bhagavān told them, 'You monks, don't drink and don't harm the bowl.'

source_sentence: 即持大師鉢，　　將昇於大樹；　滿盛白淨蜜，　　徐徐從樹下。
translation: He then took the great teacher's bowl and raised it to a large tree, filling it with pure honey as he slowly descended from it.

source_sentence: 捧持淨蜜鉢，　　奉獻大導師；　其中有虫故，　　大師不為受。
translation: He took the bowl of pure honey and offered it to the great teacher, but the teacher wouldn't accept it because there were worms in it.

source_sentence: 我即詣一邊，　　觀見而有虫；　揀擇其虫已，　　還持奉大師。
translation: I then went over to one side, observed the presence of worms, selected them, returned with them, and presented them to the great teacher.

source_sentence: 雖至如來所，　　世尊亦不受；　由未作淨故，　　善逝不納持。
translation: Even though it reached the Tathāgata, the Bhagavān didn't accept it; because it hadn't been purified, Sugata didn't accept it.

source_sentence: 我即以清水，　　點淨其蜜上；　以大至誠心，　　奉施等正覺。
translation: I then used some clean water to purify the honey on top of it and offered it to the perfectly enlightened one with a great, sincere heart.

source_sentence: 佛舒百福臂，　　無比無等手；　持我獻蜜鉢，　　與聲聞眾飲。
translation: The Buddha stretched out his arm with a hundred merits, his hand without equal, and offered me his bowl of honey to drink with the śrāvakas.

source_sentence: 情懷大欣慶，　　虔躬而合掌；　對此法王前，　　舞蹈禮已去。
translation: With great joy in his heart, he bowed his head with his palms together in reverence, danced before this Dharma king, and paid homage.

source_sentence: 我願捨命後，　　得生於人趣；　常遇大導師，　　恒持真妙法。
translation: I vowed that after I gave up my life, I'd be born in a human destiny, always meet a great teacher, and always uphold the true and wonderful Dharma.

source_sentence: 由此善根故，　　遂獲得人身；　敬奉事調御，　　無上等正覺。
translation: Because of these good roots, I've attained personal status, honored and served the tamer, and become unsurpassed and perfectly enlightened.

source_sentence: 於釋師子教，　　得為作出家；　證獲阿羅漢，　　至寂清涼處，　備六大神通。
translation: Following the lion's share of the teaching, he attains ascendancy, attains arhatship, reaches a tranquil and cool place, and is endowed with the six great supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 而此諸苾芻，　猶呼我蜜性，　　名稱福遠聞；　常受尊敬重，　　恒來供養我。
translation: These monks, however, still call me honey, whose name is well-known and meritorious, are always honored and respected, and they always come to support me.

source_sentence: 與諸苾芻眾，　　遊行於人間，　至於曠野處，　　大眾咸遭渴；　我便心起念，　　願令獲淨蜜。
translation: They wander with a multitude of beggars among humans, reaching out into the wilderness where a great multitude suffers from thirst; I then become mindful, wishing to obtain pure honey.

source_sentence: 四方非人類，　　知我心所願；　各持大蜜器，　　咸來施與我。
translation: Knowing my heart's desire, non-humans in the four directions each took a large container of honey and came to give it to me.

source_sentence: 我見即便受，　　乃至隨意足；　充滿苾芻眾，　　皆發勝上心。
translation: I accept it even as I see it, up to the point of its fulfillment, and fill it with bhikṣus who all arouse an attitude of superiority.

source_sentence: 我於猴生中，　　為王供養故；　纔捨傍生趣，　　得踐甘露地。
translation: Among the monkeys, I was offered support by the king, and I was able to step into the land of ambrosia after I had abandoned the destinies of unenlightened life.

source_sentence: 我先所有念，　　及曾發深願；　虔心奉大師，　　所作皆成辦。
translation: With all my thoughts and vows, I've devoted my heart to the great teacher and accomplished everything I set out to do.

source_sentence: 此是我所念，　　先為善業因；　今受其果報，　　微妙極受樂。
translation: These were my thoughts, which were the causes of good actions in the past, and now I'm experiencing their results, which are subtle and extremely enjoyable.

source_sentence: 此蜜性苾芻，　　對大僧伽眾，　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: This honey-natured monk told this great assembly of monks about the effects of prior actions in a pool of nonattrition."

source_sentence: 根本說一切有部毘奈耶藥事卷第十七
translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda-vinaya-medicine, Vol. 17
